contentList.content: Utility Spells
A little toolbox for custom non-combat spells and abilities.
WARNING: Inform yourself of the bugs related to this on the Appearance Edit Enhanced mod page!
Conjure Basket Full of Equipment
Conjure a Basket Full of Equipment into your inventory.

This spell conjures a Ghost Basket into your inventory that will disappear after 10 turns. Take your desired items out of the Ghost Basket before that. Everything left in the Ghost Basket will disappear forever.
Basket Full of Equipment Summoned
You summoned a temporary Basket Full of Equipment to your inventory. It and all its contents will disappear soon.
Toggles your veil's visuals on and off, if you have one selected from the mirror or character creation.
The wearer can use <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Help">Help</LSTag> as a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="BonusActionPoint">Bonus Action</LSTag>.

The wearer can use <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Help">Help</LSTag> as a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="BonusActionPoint">Bonus Action</LSTag> and they and their allies within [1] gain <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="EW_BA_STATUS_BLESS">Bless</LSTag>. This can stack with other sources of <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BLESS">Bless</LSTag>.

Creature is Bleeding profusely, taking an additional [2] Slashing damage at the start of each turn and has Disadvantage on Constitution Saving Throws. Vulnerable to Poison and Acid damage.

Removed by healing.

This weapon has exceptional balance. Roll a <LSTag Tooltip="DifficultyClass">DC</LSTag> 20 <LSTag Tooltip="Dexterity">Dexterity</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Check</LSTag> after attacking, on a successful roll raise your <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">Armour Class</LSTag> by 2 for 1 turn.
Unblockable Flail

The flexible head on this weapon makes it impossible to block properly. When you miss an <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag>, you may use a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ReactionActionPoint">Reaction</LSTag> to deal [1] regardless.
Overwhelming Force
When you miss an <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag>, you may use a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ReactionActionPoint">Reaction</LSTag> to deal [1] regardless.
Rending Blows
This weapon heavily damages enemy armour on hits, reducing the target's <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">Armour Class</LSTag> by 2 until their next turn.
Armour Penetration
This weapon easily defeats armour. Melee attacks ignore Piercing <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> and have +1 to their <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag>.
Deep Wounds
This weapon causes extreme internal damage on a good hit. Increases the damage of <LSTag Tooltip="CriticalHit">Critical Hits</LSTag> by 5.
Disarming Chain
Possbily disarm your target by wrapping the flail around their weapon unless they succeed a <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag>.
Rend
<LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">Armour Class</LSTag> is reduced by [1] until next turn.
Can Crusher
Victims of attacks from this weapon take an extra 2 damage if they are wearing metal armour.
Defensive Parry

This sword's long blade and hilt allow for effective defense. You may use a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ReactionActionPoint">Reaction</LSTag> to parry an incoming melee attack and reduce its damage by 2d6 + Your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag>. 2-Turn Cooldown.
Argument. Solved.

On <LSTag Tooltip="CriticalHit">Critical Hits</LSTag>, infects target with an evil poison that saps their very life-force. Target takes 1d8 poison damage per turn and has <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag>, <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Ability Checks</LSTag>, and <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag>. Lasts 3 turns.
Nimble Defense

This weapon has exceptional balance. Roll a <LSTag Tooltip="DifficultyClass">DC</LSTag> 20 <LSTag Tooltip="Dexterity">Dexterity</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Check</LSTag> after attacking, on a successful roll raise your <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">Armour Class</LSTag> by 2 for 3 turns.
You attacked your target with exceptional balance, raising your <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">Armour Class</LSTag> by 2 for 1 turn.
Razor Sharp

This weapon's edge is sharp enough to cut your very soul. On <LSTag Tooltip="CriticalHit">Critical Hits</LSTag>, applies <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="HEAVY_BLEEDING">Heavy Bleeding</LSTag> to target for 3 turns.
Bloody Spikes

This weapon is covered in spikes which tear flesh apart. On <LSTag Tooltip="CriticalHit">Critical Hits</LSTag>, applies <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="HEAVY_BLEEDING">Heavy Bleeding</LSTag> to the target for 3 turns.
Heavy Bleeding

Creature is Bleeding profusely, taking an additional [2] Slashing damage at the start of each turn and has Disadvantage on Constitution Saving Throws.

Removed by healing.
Argument. Solved.

Target has <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag>, <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Ability Checks</LSTag>, and <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag>. Additionally, target takes 1d8 poison damage per turn
Extremely Long
Pikes are especially long weapons, boasting the furthest reach of all melee weapons. Useful for supporting allies from relative safety.
Heavy Draw

This bow has an especially heavy draw weight. Both your <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag> and <LSTag Tooltip="Dexterity">Dexterity</LSTag> are important to be effective with this weapon. <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> and Damage rolls receive a [1] bonus. The <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> bonus for <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag> is capped at [2], however, the damage bonus is uncapped.
Mighty Overdraw

You draw the bow way further than normal for a mighty shot that hits with extreme force, at the cost of accuracy. Take a [1] <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> penalty in exchange for an extra [2].
Ease of Use
Crossbows utilize a buttstock and trigger assembly making them far easier to aim than bows and increase <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> made with them by [1].
Marksman's Focus

You calm yourself and take careful time with your shot. Spend [1] of <LSTag Tooltip="MovementSpeed">Movement Speed</LSTag> to gain <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> and reduce the <LSTag Tooltip="CriticalHit">Critical Hit</LSTag> threshhold by -4, for this attack. This effect can stack with <LSTag Tooltip="ImprovedCritical">Improved Critical</LSTag>.
Rapid Fire

You take multiple arrows in your hand and take a steady stance, preparing an onslaught for your foes. Spend 9m of <LSTag Tooltip="MovementSpeed">Movement Speed</LSTag> to shoot 3 different targets at once, at reduced damage.
Skirmisher Tactics
Shortbows are light and handy, perfect for hit and run skirmishing. Landing a hit gives you 2m of <LSTag Tooltip="MovementSpeed">Movement Speed</LSTag>.
Skirmishing
Shortbows are light and handy, perfect for hit and run skirmishing. Landing a hit gives you 2m of <LSTag Tooltip="MovementSpeed">Movement Speed</LSTag>.
Overdraw
[1] penalty to your next ranged <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Roll</LSTag> in exchange deal an extra [2].
Marksman's Focus

Gain <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> and reduce the <LSTag Tooltip="CriticalHit">Critical Hit</LSTag> threshhold by -4, for this attack. This effect can stack with <LSTag Tooltip="ImprovedCritical">Improved Critical</LSTag>.
Heavy Armour Movement Speed Penalty

Reduces <LSTag Tooltip="MovementSpeed">Movement Speed</LSTag> by [1] if your <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag> is 13 or lower while wearing Heavy Splint, Ring Mail or Chain Mail Armour and 15 or lower while wearing Heavy Plate Armour.
Shadowblade Used
You must wait until you have
You have <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourProficiency">Armour Proficiency</LSTag> with Heavy Armour and increased one <LSTag Tooltip="Abilities">Ability</LSTag> by 1.
You gain <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourProficiency">Armour Proficiency</LSTag> with Heavy Armour and increase one <LSTag Tooltip="Abilities">Ability</LSTag> by 1.

When attacking with a melee weapon you are <LSTag Tooltip="Proficiency">Proficient</LSTag> with and are wielding in both hands, <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> take a [1] penalty, but their damage increases by 1d4+[2].
Dispel the sphere of shimmering force an ally cast on you.

Make a pillar of divine fire roar down from the heavens like the wrath of affronted angels. Potentially Burns targets, fiends and undeads receive Holy Burns instead.

Allows you to cast Flamestrike Remembrance and Flamestrike Echo in your following turns.
Can recast an echo of <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="SYR_Target_FlameStrike_Recast_5A">Flamestrike Remembrance</LSTag>.

You have <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on your next <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> on the current turn, the <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> is lost upon <LSTag Tooltip="MovementSpeed">moving</LSTag>.

You give yourself <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on your next <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> on the current turn, the <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> is lost upon <LSTag Tooltip="MovementSpeed">moving</LSTag>.
Dream Shield

Kept from death's door by a brief magical boost. Gained [1] <LSTag Tooltip="TemporaryHitPoints">temporary hit points</LSTag>, <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="Wisdom">Wisdom</LSTag>, <LSTag Tooltip="Intelligence">Intelligence</LSTag>, <LSTag Tooltip="Charisma">Charisma</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag> and magic can't put you to Sleep.

You gain [1] after a <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>. Until the <LSTag Tooltip="TemporaryHitPoints">temporary hit points</LSTag> expire you also have <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="Wisdom">Wisdom</LSTag>, <LSTag Tooltip="Intelligence">Intelligence</LSTag>, <LSTag Tooltip="Charisma">Charisma</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag> and magic can't put you to Sleep.

The entity can't take <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ReactionActionPoint">Reactions</LSTag> and can only take either an <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ActionPoint">Action</LSTag> or a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="BonusActionPoint">Bonus Action</LSTag> and loses all <LSTag Tooltip="MovementSpeed">Movement</LSTag> when they do so.

Psychically lash out at [1] creature(s), possibly preventing them from taking <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ReactionActionPoint">Reactions</LSTag> and limiting it to using <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ActionPoint">Action</LSTag> or a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="BonusActionPoint">Bonus Action</LSTag> which also expends all <LSTag Tooltip="MovementSpeed">Movement</LSTag>.

Cannot move and takes [1] per turn. <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> against the creature have <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag>, while the creature's <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> and <LSTag Tooltip="Dexterity">Dexterity</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag> have <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag>. <LSTag Tooltip="Vulnerable">Vulnerable</LSTag> to Fire damage. Removed when <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Help">Helped</LSTag>.

Deal only half damage with weapon attacks that use <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag> or <LSTag Tooltip="Dexterity">Dexterity</LSTag>. <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag>, <LSTag Tooltip="Dexterity">Dexterity</LSTag> and <LSTag Tooltip="Constitution">Constitution</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag>. <LSTag Tooltip="Vulnerable">Vulnerable</LSTag> to Necrotic damage.

Weaken a foe - they deal half damage with weapon attacks using <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag> or <LSTag Tooltip="Dexterity">Dexterity</LSTag>. They also have <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag>, <LSTag Tooltip="Dexterity">Dexterity</LSTag> and <LSTag Tooltip="Constitution">Constitution</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag> and <LSTag Tooltip="Vulnerable">Vulnerable</LSTag> to Necrotic damage. The spell chains to [1] secondary target(s).
Cambion's Cauteriser
This halberd slashes with burning fury dealing an additional [1], but only for its Devil master.

A wicked moment, person, or thing that cannot be slain by sword or spell haunts your mind and flickers in your peripheral vision. You carry it wherever your adventure takes you - or perhaps it carries you.

Your experiences have granted you Expertise in Intimidation, and Darkvision.

When you kill an enemy or score a Critical Hit, all nearby enemies must succeed a Constitution Saving Throw or suffer Bleeding for 2 turns.

Once per long rest, when reduced to 0 Hit Points, the Dark Urge seizes control, pulling you back from the brink of death. You recover [1], but without succeeding a Wisdom Saving Throw you may lose yourself to its will, seeking violence upon any around you.

Once per long rest, when reduced to 0 <LSTag Tooltip="HitPoints">Hit Points</LSTag>, the Dark Urge seizes control, pulling you back from the brink of death. You recover [1], but without succeeding a <LSTag Tooltip="Wisdom">Wisdom</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag> you may lose yourself to its will, seeking violence upon any around you.

Your staff, club, javelin, spear, trident or mace becomes magical: it deals [1], adding your <LSTag Tooltip="SpellcastingAbilityModifier">Spellcasting Ability</LSTag> to its <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> and <LSTag Tooltip="">Damage Rolls</LSTag>.
The righteous blade of Helm, precisely where it belongs; buried through the chest of the wicked and the monstrous.
During the Time of Troubles, Helm was forced to slay the goddess Mystra as she tried to return home. Something in this sword's unrelenting line speaks to that grief - a duty completed, at any cost.
Landing an attack on a target heals allies for [1] in a [2] radius around you. This effect can only occur once per turn.

You have <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag> against spells. This weapon deals an additional [1] to targets <LSTag Tooltip="Concentration">Concentrating</LSTag> on a spell.
You gain a +3 bonus to Initiative Rolls and have <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on Perception <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Checks</LSTag>.
You gain an additional +[1] to <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">Armour Class</LSTag> when <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="SHIELD_OF_FAITH">Shield of Faith</LSTag> is active.
Faithguard
Entity has an additional +[1] to <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">Armour Class</LSTag> from <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="SHIELD_OF_FAITH">Shield of Faith</LSTag> being active.

When you cast a spell and spend at least 1 <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="SorceryPoint">Sorcery Point</LSTag>, you gain a bonus to your <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Spell Attack Rolls</LSTag> and <LSTag Tooltip="SpellDifficultyClass">Spell Save DC</LSTag> equal to half the spell level cast, rounded up. This bonus lasts 1 turn. This effect can only occur once per turn.
Heal a target for [1] and remove <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BLINDED">Blindness</LSTag> and any diseases.

The amulet's hunger claws at your very being, demanding sacrifice for its power. At the start of combat, you suffer [1] but become armoued with shadowy energy. Until combat ends, you gain a bonus to <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">Armour Class</LSTag> equal to half your Charisma <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityModifier">Modifier</LSTag>, rounded up, up to a max of +4.

The amulet's insatiable hunger sinks its teeth into you, forging a shield of dark power from your stolen life force. Until combat ends, you have a bonus to <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">Armour Class</LSTag> equal to half your Charisma <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityModifier">Modifier</LSTag>, rounded up, up to a max of +4.

The dagger resonates with the eternal nature of your pact, granting you unique benefits that reflect your chosen pact.

Pact of the Blade - While Pact Weapon is active, your weapon deals an additional [1] and you gain Resistance to Psychic damage. This effect can only occur once per turn.

Pact of the Chain - Your familiars gain an additional +[2] to Armour Class and Attack Rolls, in addition to temporary hit points equal to twice your Warlock level.

Pact of the Tome - You gain +[3] to spell Attack Rolls and Spell Save DC, and your cantrips also deal an additonal [4]. This effect can only occur once per turn.

While Boots of the Marsh Strider are equipped your <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Projectile_Jump">Jump</LSTag>; distance is increased by [1], and your <LSTag Tooltip="MovementSpeed">Movement Speed</LSTag> is increased by [2].

Unleash a spark of celestial lightning in a [1] radius around you. Each creature in the area must make a <LSTag Tooltip="Constitution">Constitution</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag> or take [2]. On a save, targets still take half damage.

Leeching the psychic energy of those around him.

Receives a +[1] bonus to Attack Rolls and deals an additional [2] per creature he's connected to.
Archivist

You've spent countless days in the preferred seclusion of libraries and archives, poring over the tomes within. You are particularly adept at reading, parsing, and copying someone else's work - and pay half price to copy Enchantment, Divination, and Conjuration spell scrolls. You also proficient in the Arcana and History skills.
Cartographer

You were trained and employed in the exacting art of cartography. You know what plants grow where, the forgotten places of distant memories, and how to navigate terrain. You are proficient in Nature, History, and Survival. You have Advantage on Survival checks.
Courier

Working for your local postal service has taught you the value of being reliable, diligent, and timely. You are confident leading and riding animals, and are used to long days spent on your own feet, and can handle packages with discretion. You are proficient in Animal Handling, Athletics, and Stealth.
Devil's Bargain

You made a deal with a fiend from one of the Nine Hells. You've been granted a devil's silver tongue, but it comes with a lead foot: You have advantage on all Charisma skill checks, but you have disadvantage on all Charisma saving throws. A piece of your soul has been lost forever.
Gambler
You know when to hold them, when to fold them, when to walk away, and when to run. You are proficient in Deception, Sleight of Hand, and Insight.
Gladiator

You fought for survival as a slave or possibly as a celebrity competitor. One way or another, you developed a proficiency for a variety of weapons to remain ready for what can be found in an arena: Clubs, daggers, handaxes, javelins, spears, scimitars, tridents, and even firearms. You know a good show can be critical to survival, and are proficient in Performance.
God-Touched

You had some form of direct interaction with a powerful deity in your past. The experience has gifted your mind with incredible fortitude, but enfeebled your physical form. You have advantage on Wisdom saving throws, but disadvantage on Constitution saving throws.
Merchant

You made your coin by selling goods to the fair folk who frequented your stall. Sales are made on a combination of persuasion and marketing, and you are proficient in Persuasion and Deception. You also have a keen eye for details; you are proficient in Investigation and Perception.
Pugilist

Fighting is not just your life but your career, with legal boxing matches and shady back alleys offering fame and fortune. Surviving as many rounds as you have confers proficiency in Atheltics and Acrobatics. Reading your opponent and entertaining a crowd has made you proficient in Insight and Performance.
Beatific Restoration
Tap into your gift to replenish an expended <LSTag Tooltip="SpellSlot">spell slot</LSTag> of any level.
Usable once per <LSTag Tooltip="ShortRest">Short Rest</LSTag> or once per <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Shout_Wildshape_Panther">Wild Shape</LSTag>.
